question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Trait implementation] Can malicious implementations of FileStoreOperator violate trait invariants like version alignment to FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT boundaries, breaking callers' assumptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Trait implementation] Does the trait provide sufficient guarantees about thread safety (Send + Sync at line 20), or can implementations introduce data races in mutable operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Trait implementation] Can implementations return malicious Transaction protobuf data from get_transactions() that exploits deserialization vulnerabilities in downstream consumers? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Trait implementation] Can implementations violate the expected relationship between get_latest_version() and actual stored transactions, causing indexers to miss data or request non-existent versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Async safety] Can cancellation of async methods like get_transactions() or upload_transaction_batch() leave the file store in an inconsistent state with partial writes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Async safety] Does the async trait at line 19 properly handle panics in async methods, or can panics in implementations poison shared state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Async safety] Can concurrent async calls to different methods on the same FileStoreOperator instance create race conditions in shared state like metadata caches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Async safety] Can the tokio::task::spawn_blocking call at line 70 be starved or deadlock when too many concurrent get_transactions_with_durations() calls are made? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Constant vulnerability] Can METADATA_FILE_NAME at line 16 be manipulated through path traversal to access or overwrite files outside the intended metadata location? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Constant vulnerability] Is FILE_STORE_UPDATE_FREQUENCY_SECS at line 17 being used consistently across implementations, or can timing mismatches cause metadata update conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Constant vulnerability] Can FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT value of 1000 be overridden in implementations causing batch size mismatches that corrupt transaction storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Error handling] When get_raw_file_with_retries() exhausts all retries at line 49, does the error provide enough context for callers to distinguish between missing files vs. corruption vs. access denied? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Error handling] Can errors in get_transactions_with_durations() be suppressed by the spawn_blocking context wrapper at line 74, hiding critical failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Edge case] What happens when version is 0 in get_transactions() - can this cause issues with version % FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT calculation or skip operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Edge case] When upload_transaction_batch() is called with an empty Vec<Transaction>, can this create a 0-byte file entry that breaks subsequent reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Edge case] Can requesting transactions at version u64::MAX-999 cause integer overflow when calculating the file boundary or skip offset? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Data integrity] Does get_transactions() verify that returned transactions match the requested version range, or can implementations return wrong transactions without detection? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Data integrity] Can the skip operation at line 81 accidentally skip more or fewer transactions than intended due to iterator implementation details? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Data integrity] Is there any verification that transactions uploaded via upload_transaction_batch() have sequential version numbers without gaps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Data integrity] Can FileStoreMetadata be updated without actually uploading corresponding transaction files, creating a version gap that causes reads to fail? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [DoS] Can repeatedly calling get_transactions() with invalid versions that trigger retries amplify load on storage systems causing service degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [DoS] Can requesting very old version numbers cause implementations to search through massive amounts of storage, creating DoS through excessive I/O? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [DoS] Can spawning too many concurrent get_transactions_with_durations() calls exhaust the tokio blocking thread pool causing deadlocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [DoS] Can malformed compressed data in storage cause decompression to consume excessive CPU in the spawn_blocking thread at line 70? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Version boundary] Can providing version = FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT - 1 cause off-by-one errors in file path calculation or transaction extraction? (High)
